file_content.text: Something on your mind?
I need your help with something.
What can I do for you?
Ask away.
Is this a personal matter?
Something private?
No, just don't need to have a committee for this discussion.
You just wanted to get me alone.
[Flirt] Privately?
Guilty, but business before pleasure.
It's amazing how often that seems to be the case.
You always do.
Important person, important problems.
I passed a portion of that data you secured from Overwatch through an SIS contact of mine.
It made a convincing invitation to some prospective allies in the Republic Special Forces.
Who is it you're planning to recruit?
Anyone interesting?
I identified a sympathetic ear in the leader of the Republic's most decorated military unit.
Anyone I'm familiar with?
Who?
It's your old outfit, though only one of your former unit is still attached.
You aren't very trusting of your former masters, are you?
Very selective of you.
A whisper in the right ear often gets you further than shouting at all the wrong ones.
Why not take it to Republic command?
Only prospects?
The Republic at large isn't in any shape to engage Zakuul in a full-scale war. They wouldn't listen.
If Arcann catches wind that we have that data, we lose a significant advantage.
That was risky.
I did say a portion. Not enough to infer that we have a complete map of the Spire.
The data I gave over was enough to convince Havoc Squad to take leave of their official duties.
I have it on good authority they're conducting an... "unscheduled" operation on Zakuul. My contact set up a rendezvous, but it's up to you to sell them on this alliance.
I'm not seeing why you really need my help.
Wouldn't they be more receptive to one of their own?
Havoc starting their own little war out here is basically treason.
If it gets out that I had a hand in poaching them, I may find myself real short on friends back in the Republic.
I'm a spy. If anything they'll be even less likely to trust me than you.
I'll be on the Gravestone when you're ready.
It's weird, right? The Captain not being here.
Koth and I had our differences, but I didn't want things to end like that.
Things could've ended better.
Valkorion is inside my head. This is nothing.
Weirder things have happened.
Koth's dead to me. Anyone who feels differently can join him.
He betrayed me.
He just... left.
I can't believe he's gone.
You're not going to cry, are you? Cause I can come back.
You're telling me. He stole my favorite shuttle.
Well, yeah. When you put it that way.
Drop the look. I'm the one who stood between him and the Gravestone, remember?
This might surprise you, but I'm not big on heart-to-hearts. So let's get this over with.
You don't have to worry about me, Ralo, and the others.
You don't have to worry about me and the others.
We're with you. As captains go, Koth wasn't a complete Hutt-stain, but you provide a steady paycheck and nice toys.
Wow, Tora. That actually sounded sincere.
That was almost touching.
I'll be honest, I thought you would've stayed with Koth.
Your loyalty surprises me.
How do I know you're not spying for him?
I'm supposed to trust you?
What do you want? A pinky promise?
Darth Eyeliner already interrogated us and we got her approval. That should be enough.
Don't get me wrong. It's mainly about the creds.
Blind loyalty is stupid. And I'm a genius.
The Gravestone can't fly itself. You need a crew. We're here and ready.
In the meantime, Old Man Shan's waiting for you. Good talk.
And, well, the Alliance is changing things in a big way. We're proud to be a part of it.
